items.title: Bank of America tops analysts' estimates on better-than-expected interest income, trading
items.content: Bank of America shares have sold off in recent weeks on concern that President Donald Trump's tariff policies could cause a recession.
items.contentSnippet: Bank of America shares have sold off in recent weeks on concern that President Donald Trump's tariff policies could cause a recession.

items.title: American Airlines to make Wi-Fi free on most of its fleet in 2026
items.content: American Airlines is following other airlines such as Delta and JetBlue in making Wi-Fi free on board.
items.contentSnippet: American Airlines is following other airlines such as Delta and JetBlue in making Wi-Fi free on board.

items.title: Auto stocks rise as Trump says he wants to 'help' some car companies
items.content: The comments pushed stocks such as Ford, GM and Chrysler parent Stellantis higher, swinging from trading levels or negative to being up between 1% and 4%.
items.contentSnippet: The comments pushed stocks such as Ford, GM and Chrysler parent Stellantis higher, swinging from trading levels or negative to being up between 1% and 4%.

items.title: Goldman Sachs tops estimates on boom in equities trading revenue
items.content: Goldman Sachs joins rivals JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley in posting better-than-expected equities trading revenue.
items.contentSnippet: Goldman Sachs joins rivals JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley in posting better-than-expected equities trading revenue.

items.title: Pfizer scraps daily weight loss pill after liver injury in one patient
items.content: The decision to stop developing danuglipron adds to a string of setbacks in the pharmaceutical giant's bid to win a slice of the booming market for GLP-1s.
items.contentSnippet: The decision to stop developing danuglipron adds to a string of setbacks in the pharmaceutical giant's bid to win a slice of the booming market for GLP-1s.

items.title: Airlines bank even more on splurging vacationers as clouds form on economy
items.content: Carriers are hoping that wealthier leisure travelers will continue to treat themselves to pricier, roomier seats.
items.contentSnippet: Carriers are hoping that wealthier leisure travelers will continue to treat themselves to pricier, roomier seats.

items.title: Sports teams adopt tactile tech for blind and low-vision fans
items.content: Professional sports teams are partnering with startups to introduce technology for blind and visually impaired fans to better experience live games.
items.contentSnippet: Professional sports teams are partnering with startups to introduce technology for blind and visually impaired fans to better experience live games.

items.title: Trump's ongoing 25% auto tariffs expected to cut sales by millions, cost $100 billion
items.content: Expectations include millions of less vehicle sales, higher new and used vehicle prices and increased costs of more than $100 billion for the industry.
items.contentSnippet: Expectations include millions of less vehicle sales, higher new and used vehicle prices and increased costs of more than $100 billion for the industry.

items.title: The Real ID deadline is just weeks away. Here's what travelers need to know
items.content: Travelers will need a Real ID-compliant license or other accepted form of identification like a passport to get through security before a domestic U.S. flight.
items.contentSnippet: Travelers will need a Real ID-compliant license or other accepted form of identification like a passport to get through security before a domestic U.S. flight.

items.title: GM cutting jobs, idling Canadian electric van plant due to 'market demand'
items.content: General Motors is cutting production of its all-electric delivery vans at a plant in Canada ahead of idling the facility through much of this year.
items.contentSnippet: General Motors is cutting production of its all-electric delivery vans at a plant in Canada ahead of idling the facility through much of this year.

items.title: Mortgage rates surge over 7% as tariffs hit bond market
items.content: Mortgage rates surged over 7% to end the week, after massive volatility in bond markets surrounding President Donald Trump's tariff agenda.
items.contentSnippet: Mortgage rates surged over 7% to end the week, after massive volatility in bond markets surrounding President Donald Trump's tariff agenda.

items.title: Trump's pharmaceutical tariffs could raise costs for patients, worsen drug shortages
items.content: It's unclear whether tariffs will influence more companies to make more drugs in the U.S. like President Donald Trump is hoping for, some experts said.
items.contentSnippet: It's unclear whether tariffs will influence more companies to make more drugs in the U.S. like President Donald Trump is hoping for, some experts said.

items.title: Hollywood's Chinese box office was already in decline even before Trump's tariffs
items.content: China is restricting Hollywood film imports after President Donald Trump escalated tariffs. However, ticket sales from this box office have been in decline for the last five years.
items.contentSnippet: China is restricting Hollywood film imports after President Donald Trump escalated tariffs. However, ticket sales from this box office have been in decline for the last five years.

items.title: Mattel and Hasbro stocks notch new lows after Trump's China tariff escalation
items.content: Toy giants Mattel and Hasbro have seen their stocks battered by President Donald Trump's escalated trade war with China.
items.contentSnippet: Toy giants Mattel and Hasbro have seen their stocks battered by President Donald Trump's escalated trade war with China.

items.title: Jamie Dimon says he expects S&P 500 earnings estimates to fall as companies pull guidance
items.content: "Analysts have generally reduced their S&P estimate earnings by 5%," in recent days, Dimon said. "I think you'll see that come down some more."
items.contentSnippet: "Analysts have generally reduced their S&P estimate earnings by 5%," in recent days, Dimon said. "I think you'll see that come down some more."

items.title: Frontier Airlines cuts flights after travel demand fell in March
items.content: Frontier follows Delta in pulling its 2025 full-year forecast due to economic uncertainty.
items.contentSnippet: Frontier follows Delta in pulling its 2025 full-year forecast due to economic uncertainty.

items.title: Morgan Stanley tops quarterly estimates as equity trading revenue surges 45%
items.content: Shares of Morgan Stanley, like those of its peers, have whipsawed in recent days amid President Donald Trump's trade policies.
items.contentSnippet: Shares of Morgan Stanley, like those of its peers, have whipsawed in recent days amid President Donald Trump's trade policies.

items.title: MLB could draw greater private equity interest as uncertainties lie ahead
items.content: MLB teams have been slowly attracting private equity investors as the league braces for potential changes to player salaries and media rights deals.
items.contentSnippet: MLB teams have been slowly attracting private equity investors as the league braces for potential changes to player salaries and media rights deals.

items.title: New York is still the richest wealth hub. Here's which cities are gaining ground
items.content: New York City and the Bay Area are the world's richest wealth hubs, but Miami and Houston are gaining ground.
items.contentSnippet: New York City and the Bay Area are the world's richest wealth hubs, but Miami and Houston are gaining ground.

items.title: The wealthy are loading up on cash, gold and family trusts during market turmoil
items.content: Several top executives in wealth management said that unlike the crashes in 2020 or 2008, high-net-worth investors were feeling less pressure to sell.
items.contentSnippet: Several top executives in wealth management said that unlike the crashes in 2020 or 2008, high-net-worth investors were feeling less pressure to sell.

items.title: Trumpâ€™s pivot on tariffs shows that Wall Street still has a seat at his table
items.content: This past week shows that financial markets, and by proxy Wall Street statesmen like Jamie Dimon, are still guardrails on the Trump administration.
items.contentSnippet: This past week shows that financial markets, and by proxy Wall Street statesmen like Jamie Dimon, are still guardrails on the Trump administration.

items.title: State Farm pleads for emergency rate hikes on California homeowners
items.content: State Farm argues it needs additional funds to boost capital and avert an increasingly dire financial situation following the devastating Los Angeles wildfires.
items.contentSnippet: State Farm argues it needs additional funds to boost capital and avert an increasingly dire financial situation following the devastating Los Angeles wildfires.

items.title: Trump's immigration policy is weighing on beer sales, Constellation Brands CEO says
items.content: Roughly half of Constellation's beer sales come from Hispanic consumers.
items.contentSnippet: Roughly half of Constellation's beer sales come from Hispanic consumers.

items.title: MLB weighs a salary cap as potential lockout looms in 2026
items.content: MLB executives at both the league and team level have discussed what a new league economic structure could look like as the CBA expires 2026.
items.contentSnippet: MLB executives at both the league and team level have discussed what a new league economic structure could look like as the CBA expires 2026.

items.title: Delta CEO says Trump tariffs are hurting bookings as airline pulls 2025 forecast
items.content: Delta said it couldn't reaffirm its 2025 financial guidance.
items.contentSnippet: Delta said it couldn't reaffirm its 2025 financial guidance.

items.title: Walmart says Trump tariffs could hit quarterly profits as it tries to keep prices low
items.content: Walmart said it wants to maintain the ability to keep prices low, which could affect its profits.
items.contentSnippet: Walmart said it wants to maintain the ability to keep prices low, which could affect its profits.

items.title: Here's how China could crush the U.S. housing market
items.content: China is one of largest owners of U.S. mortgages. There is growing concern that in retaliation for tariffs the country could sell them, causing rates to rise.
items.contentSnippet: China is one of largest owners of U.S. mortgages. There is growing concern that in retaliation for tariffs the country could sell them, causing rates to rise.

items.title: Pharmaceutical stocks rise as Trump pauses tariffs but not for China
